availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: David J. Hooser (Christian County, Kentucky, tinner and coppersmith.)

body.p: Christian County, Kentucky, tinner and coppersmith. Todd County, Kentucky, native. Married to Mary Jane Overshiner Hooser in Christian County, Kentucky, on January 9, 1838. Father of Virginia Hooser, Barbry Ann Hooser, Albert Hooser, Mary Hooser, Julia Hooser, and Cornelia Hooser. Resident of Christian County, Kentucky, in 1840. Owned three enslaved persons in Christian County in 1840. Tinner in Christian County in 1850. Owned four enslaved persons in Christian County in 1850. Tinner and coppersmith in Christian County in 1860. Owned fifteen enslaved persons in Christian County in 1860. Employed J.W. Kennedy and Henry Ballard as journeymen tinners in Christian County in 1860.
